ARABIC: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And he drew out his hand and there it was, pure white to those who looked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it looked white to the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and he drew his hand (out of his armpit) and lo! it had become a shining object to the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Then he uncovered his hand and it was sheer white to the onlookers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And he drew forth his hand, thereupon it shone bright before the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And he drew forth his hand, and lo! it appeared white to the onlookers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it was white to the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white to the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: And he drew out his hand, and it appeared [shining] white to the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And he drew forth his hand, and lo! it was white unto the beholders.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white and bright to the onlookers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then he drew out his hand, and it was luminous to the onlookers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And he pulled his hand; and it was white, for all to see.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:33] Then he drew out his hand, he brought it out of his pocket, and lo! it was white, glowing, before the onlookers, and not its usual skin colour.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Pharaoh then said: "this is a manifest sign, do you have any other signs?" (And he drew forth his hand) from 408 his armpit (and lo! it was white to the beholders) his hand had a light like the light of the sun, and whoever looked at it liked it.
